reviews.review_msg: Nicky is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is kind, compassionate, and super funny too. I took this class for the Q credit but left throughly surprised at how much fun I had. Definitely talk to her one on one because she is super accommodating and goes out of her way to help you succeed. I look forward to taking more courses with her!

Nicky did not even pretend to care about the wellbeing of her students in the middle of a global pandemic. Grading criteria was never explained and instructions were always unclear. For the most part, you had to teach yourself. This course had so much potential but was one of the worst courses I've ever taken. Avoid this prof at all costs.

I'm an English major, and I really did not like Nicky's class. Her expectations were unclear, and despite this, she still marked hard. She gave me a terrible mark on my project for no reason, and when I asked her to explain why, she couldn't.

i loved having dr. didicher as a prof! these negative reviews are so crazy to me, because i'm in my 3rd yr. now and it's safe to say that she's hands down one of the best teachers at sfu. she's really caring towards her students and extremely passionate. people say she's a tough marker but i didn't really feel that at all. 10/10

Nicky had me extremely worried at the beginning of the semester. Her course seemed unmanageable and too challenging for a 200 level course. However, once I got into the course a bit more it all started to clear up and by the end of the semester I was so glad I stuck through it!!

Nicky is quite possibly one of the nicest professors I have had at SFU. She is truly interested in helping you. For a 2nd year class her marking was fair. She is quite focused on 'student centred learning' which, can make things more difficult to learn at times but she is always willing to answer questions. Be ready to participate in her class!
